refnamediv.refpurpose: Clips a signal to a predefined limit.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Clips an a-rate signal to a predefined limit, in a soft manner, using one of three methods.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares clip asig, imeth, ilimit [, iarg]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para:
imeth -- selects the clipping method. The default is 0. The methods are:
0 = Bram de Jong method (default)
1 = sine clipping
2 = tanh clipping
iarg (optional, default=0.5) -- when imeth = 0, indicates the point at which clipping starts, in the range 0 - 1. Not used when imeth = 1 or imeth = 2. Default is 0.5.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: The Bram de Jong method (imeth = 0) applies the algorithm (denoting ilimit as limit and iarg as a):

informalexample.programlisting: |x| >= 0 and |x| <= (limit*a): f(x) = f(x) |x| > (limit*a) and |x| <= limit: f(x) = sign(x) * (limit*a+(x-limit*a)/(1+((x-limit*a)/(limit*(1-a)))2)) |x| > limit: f(x) = sign(x) * (limit*(1+a))/2

refsect1.para: The second method (imeth = 1) is the sine clip:

informalexample.programlisting: |x| < limit: f(x) = limit * sin(π*x/(2*limit)), |x| >= limit: f(x) = limit * sign(x)

refsect1.para: The third method (imeth = 2) is the tanh clip:

informalexample.programlisting: |x| < limit: f(x) = limit * tanh(x/limit)/tanh(1), |x| >= limit: f(x) = limit * sign(x)

note.title: Note
note.para: Method 1 appears to be non-functional at release of Csound version 4.07.
